column1: These settings let the store owner to deliver the highest quality posts on Facebook or other social networks and sharing the product links in messengers. Adding Open Graph tags to the store pages will help the Facebook Crawler pick up the right title and description for the shared page, as well as supply them with the most suitable preview image. Visit this page to learn more about the way Open Graph tags work.
column2: These settings let the store owner to deliver the highest quality posts on Facebook or other social networks and sharing the product links in messengers. Adding Open Graph tags to the store pages will help the Facebook Crawler pick up the right title and description for the shared page, as well as supply them with the most suitable preview image. Visit this page to learn more about the way Open Graph tags work.

column1: These settings provide a media-rich experience to those who view your Twitter content. If enabled, the standard Tweet with the website URL will be transformed into the Summary Card and accompanied with an additional title, an extra up-to-200 words description, and an image. To enable the feature, make sure you enter Twitter Username. Visit this page to learn more about Twitter Cards.
